rev.comment: Templated two "Entertainment Weekly" web articles, listed authors.
Wikified Adweek in reference
Wikified Time (magazine) and another instance of "The New York Times" in references
Wikified Ashgate Publishing; changed boston.com to The Boston Globe (same) and wikified; also bloomberg.com to Bloomberg L.P. (same)
Wikified author Mark Savage
Changed editors to last name, first name format for "The Madonna Companion"
Corrected spelling and Wikified publisher "Schirmer Books"; omitted SFGate which is essentially the same as San Francisco Chronicle, which is already Wikified
Tweaked format of reference for New York Times film review of "Dangerous Game"
Wiki-linked some publishers' names to help researchers keep track of "who is who & what is what" in this extremely detailed article
Corrected names of publishers of two referenced books; various wiki-links to help researchers in this very detailed article
Wikified "NME News"
Wiki-linked "RTE Entertainment" to "RTÉ.ie"
I think this contributor meant "audio CD". I find no evidence that Spears' "Me Against the Music: Extra Tracks" was ever issued as a Video CD. Only audio. Changed template, linked RS review of album
/* 2002–2006: American Life and Confessions on a Dance Floor */ minor grammar correction for apostrophe after name that ends with "s"
Cited actual name of publisher of "Me Against the Music" and wikified.
Externally linked article from AfterEllen.com about steamy kiss with Aguilera and Spears. Wikified applicable entries.
Wikified "BBC h2g2"
Wikified "The Sydney Morning Herald". Italicized "Up For Grabs" in reference
Wikified "MTV News", a separate wiki article from MTV that needs expansion. Other misc. wikifications
Wikified "BBC Radio 2"
corrected publisher of Mary Cross's biography in one location; added ISBN in another. Corrected year from 2004 to 2007
Deleted "Telegraph Media Group" in note. Redundant, can be learned by clicking adjacent link of "The Daily Telegraph". changed all refs of same in footnotes for consistency
